comments:
-Create jikes as a remote project and enable the "Automatic Parse upon resource
modification".
-After the project is opened, the project is automatically parsed as expected.
-In the C/C++ Project Objects view, double click on a function(e.g.
"ZipFile::GetU1()")  to open it in the editor. Then add a blank line to the file
and save it.
-The save triggers an automatic parse which results in an internal error. Here
is the log:

I've seen this happen locally as well as remotely.  Also, it appears to be 
independent of autoparse.  Somehow we're getting a reference in our list of 
contents, but the reference doesn't have a descriptor.  I've saw a couple other 
bugs while investigating this one.  There are fixes but I will need to look 
closer in this area.
